articles.title: Inflation and end of government stimulus creating 'hungriest summer'
articles.description: Americans are getting back to work and even securing higher wages, but inflation and government aid ending mean more people can't afford groceries.
articles.content:
Melvin Adkins' family has been using a food pantry in Kent County, Maryland, since the 77-year-old retired a few years ago.
"Food prices going up have impacted everything," Adkins told Insider."You … [+3340 chars]

articles.description: Netflix said it's aiming to launch a cheaper ad-supported tier in early 2023 as it bleeds subscribers.
